title: Ian Coutts
text:
Ian Douglas Freeman Coutts (27 April 1928 – 3 May 1997) was a Scottish sportsman from England who played <a href="cricket">cricket</a> at <a href="first-class%20cricket">first-class</a> level and who represented <a href="Scotland%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Scotland</a> in <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> from 1951 to 1952.
Early life.
Ian Coutts was born on 27 April 1928 in <a href="Herne%20Hill">Herne Hill</a>, south <a href="London">London</a> and attended <a href="Dulwich%20College">Dulwich College</a>. He played both rugby and cricket for the school's first teams. He went up to <a href="Lincoln%20College%2C%20Oxford">Lincoln College, Oxford</a>, after a break due to <a href="National%20Service">National Service</a>. Coutts was selected for the 1950 Oxford University A side and in 1951 and 1952 won blues for cricket. He also won a rugby blue.
Rugby union career.
After university Coutts played his club rugby for <a href="Northampton%20Saints">Northampton</a> and was also a regular in his schools old boys side, <a href="Old%20Alleynian%20FC">the Old Alleynians</a>. He made his international debut for <a href="Scotland%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Scotland</a> whilst still at Oxford, on 13 January 1951 at <a href="Colombes">Colombes</a> against <a href="France%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">France</a>. Scotland lost this game, and Coutts was also on the losing side when he won his second cap on 15 March 1952, this time against <a href="England%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">England</a>.
Cricket.
Coutts only <a href="first-class%20cricket">first-class cricket</a> experience was for <a href="Oxford%20University%20Cricket%20Club">Oxford University</a>, as a right arm medium-fast bowler. From 15 matches he took 33 wickets at 35.75. He also later turned out for a number of other sides, including the <a href="Harlequins%20cricket%20team">Harlequins cricket team</a> in 1953, as well as the <a href="Free%20Foresters%20Cricket%20Club">Free Foresters</a> in the same year. From 1957 to 1959 he played a number of times for the <a href="Cryptics%20Cricket%20Club">Cryptics</a> and he also turned out for the Old Alleynians cricket side.
